Grieving family demand answers, allege ‘cover-up’ months after child sex offender’s Northland prison death https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/grieving-family-demand-answers-allege-cover-cover-months-months-fer-child-child-sex-risters-northland-prison--northland-prison-death/bktq2k2k2k2k2k2k2k23srckktcjskp43wwz6bkki/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/grieving-family-demand-answers-allege-cover-cover-months-months-fer-child-child-sex-risters-northland-prison--northland-prison-death/bktq2k2k2k2k2k2k2k23srckktcjskp43wwz6bkki/ Lane NicholsKingi Hemi died in Ngawha Prison in November. His cause of death remains unknown. Sat, 05 Apr 2025 17:00:00 +0000 Kingi Hemi, 40, died in Ngawha Prison on November 20 while serving a six-year sentence for child sex offences. His death is "unexplained".
Government orders four Māori influencers to stop promoting online gambling - or face $10k fine https://www.nzherald.co.nz/kahu/government-orders-maori-influencers-to-stop-promoting-online-nline-gambling-or-face-or-face-10k-fine/be66nannafh5jem7jn7jn7qxqmyrllosi/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/kahu/government-orders-maori-influencers-to-stop-promoting-online-nline-gambling-or-face-or-face-10k-fine/be66nannafh5jem7jn7jn7qxqmyrllosi/ Joseph Los'eOnline casinos have enjoyed a surge in promotion by Māori influencers Sat, 05 Apr 2025 17:00:00 +0000 Māori health organisation Hāpai Te Hauora gave the Herald a list of influencers who have promoted online gambling. The DIA would not reveal which four had received letters.
